entry.title: Panda Tricks: Resampling
entry.summary: Resampling to align differentially-sampled time series data
entry.content:

div.cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  border-radius: 2px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  position: relative;
  overflow: visible;
}
div.cell:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: transparent;
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
}
div.cell.selected:before,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected:before {
  position: absolute;

  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #42A5F5;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.selected,

    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected {

}

}

  }
}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;

}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;

  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;

  display: -webkit-box;

  display: -moz-box;

  display: box;

}

div.input_prompt {

/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;

}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;

  display: box;

}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {

}
div.output_area 
div.output_area

}
div.output_area img.unconfined,

}
div.output_area .mglyph > img {

}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;

  display: box;

@media (max-width: 540px) {

    /* Old browsers */

    -webkit-box-align: stretch;

    -moz-box-orient: vertical;

    display: box;

div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 1px 0 1px 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
div.output_unrecognized {

}

}

}

}
.rendered_html :visited {

}

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Up--then-down--sampling">Up- then down- sampling<a class="anchor-link" href="#Up--then-down--sampling">¶</a></h1><h3 id="The-Problem:"><em>The Problem:</em><a class="anchor-link" href="#The-Problem:">¶</a></h3><p>We have a collection of time-series data. A given entity (here: subway station) is measured (here: for passenger volume) at some frequency. The exact timing of the sampling times is not consistent from entity to entity. For example, one station is sampled at midnight, 4am, 8am, noon, etc. Another is sampled at 2am, 6am, 10am, 2pm, etc. How can we compare time-vs-volume if samplling times are not aligned?</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="A-Solution:">A Solution:<a class="anchor-link" href="#A-Solution:">¶</a></h3><p>The astute blog-readers among you may have noticed an anomaly in my last blog post:</p>
<p><img src="'images/heatmap.png'" alt="Heatmap"></p>
<p>Notice that four of the stations have peak volume at the '16h' block, but 5AV/53ST's peak occurs during the 12h block. Upon digging deeper, I realized that was not real, but was an artifact of how we resampled the data.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Station volume data is reported every 4 hours. Most stations' data were reported at midnight (0h), 4am, 8am, noon (12h), etc:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [51]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'STATION'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'BOROUGH HALL'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'DATETIME'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[51]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>

    }

        vertical-align: top;
    }

        text-align: right;

</style>

</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>A few stations were reported at "odd" times, e.g. 2am, 6am, 10am, etc:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'STATION'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'59 ST'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[7]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>STATION</th>
      <th>DATETIME</th>

    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>

      <th>0</th>

      <td>15.0</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>329</th>
      <td>59 ST</td>
      <td>2018-05-19</td>
      <td>30.0</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>495</th>
      <td>59 ST</td>
      <td>2018-05-19</td>
      <td>62.0</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>662</th>
      <td>59 ST</td>

      <td>52.0</td>

</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Originally, we simply performed a <code>resample</code>' of each station's volume data every 4 hours.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_index</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'DATETIME'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">df2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'STATION'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">resample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rule</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'4H'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Note that the dataframe you are resampling must have a 'datetime' index, or you need to pass datetime values to the <code>on</code> keyword.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>For the stations that were already sampled at at 0h, 4h, 8h, 12h, etc, this worked (or more accurately, it did nothing). For the stations which had odd sampling times, this resulted in odd and incorrected splitting of the volume (see the blue line in the plot below).</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The solution is to "up" sample every 1h, then "down" sample to 4h. I created a "mini" dataframe for each station, grouped-by dateime (which then becomes the index), and then performed the up-then-down resampling.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">up_then_down</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">station</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">df1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'STATION'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">station</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">df2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'DATETIME'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">df3</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">resample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rule</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'1H'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ffill</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">df3</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">resample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rule</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'4H'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This resulted in a "smoother" resampling:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><img src="images/line-plot-old-vs-new.png" alt="Line plot resampled odd station" width="600" align=“center”/></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Plotting this data as the heatmap shown at the beginning of this post, we see the "odd" station now looks as expected:</p>
<p><img src="images/heatmap_resampled.svg" alt="Heatmap resampled odd station" width="600" align="center"/></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>I would be remiss not to provide the links to the pandas documentation and user guide on resampling. One resamping does not an expert make!</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/generated/pandas.DataFrame.resample.html">Documentation</a></li>
<li><a href="http://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/timeseries.html#resampling">User Guide</a></li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>
</div>

        "    showMathMenu: true," +
        "    tex2jax: { " +
        "        inlineMath: [ ['$','$'] ], " +
        "        displayMath: [ ['$$','$$'] ]," +
        "        processEscapes: true," +
        "        preview: 'TeX'," +
        "    }, " +
        "    'HTML-CSS': { " +
        " linebreaks: { automatic: true, width: '95% container' }, " +
        "        styles: { '.MathJax_Display, .MathJax .mo, .MathJax .mi, .MathJax .mn': {color: 'black ! important'} }" +
        "    } " +
        "}); ";
    (document.body || document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0]).appendChild(mathjaxscript);
}
</script>

entry.title: Panda Tricks: Self-Joins
entry.summary: Self-join to extract information from two columns
entry.content:
<style type="text/css">/*!
*
* IPython notebook
*
*/
/* CSS font colors for translated ANSI escape sequences */
/* The color values are a mix of
   http://www.xcolors.net/dl/baskerville-ivorylight and
   http://www.xcolors.net/dl/euphrasia */
.ansi-black-fg {
  color: #3E424D;
}
.ansi-black-bg {
  background-color: #3E424D;
}
.ansi-black-intense-fg {
  color: #282C36;
}
.ansi-black-intense-bg {

}
.ansi-red-fg {

}

}

}

}
.ansi-green-fg {

}

}

}

}

}
.ansi-blue-intense-bg {

}
.ansi-magenta-fg {

}
.ansi-magenta-bg {

}

}
.ansi-magenta-intense-bg {

}
.ansi-cyan-fg {

.ansi-default-inverse-fg {

}
.ansi-bold {
  font-weight: bold;
}
.ansi-underline {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
/* The following styles are deprecated an will be removed in a future version */
.ansibold {

}
.ansi-inverse {

}
/* use dark versions for foreground, to improve visibility */
.ansiblack {

}
.ansired {

}

}

/* and light for background, for the same reason */

div.cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  border-radius: 2px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  position: relative;
  overflow: visible;
}
div.cell:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: transparent;
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
}
div.cell.selected:before,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #42A5F5;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.selected,
  div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #66BB6A;
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #66BB6A;
}
@media print {
  .edit_mode div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {
  border-radius: 2px;
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.input {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;

    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;

    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}
/*

  background-position: right;

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {
  text-align: left !important;
}
div.output_area 
div.output_area 
div.output_area img,
div.output_area svg {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}
div.output_area img.unconfined,
div.output_area svg.unconfined {
  max-width: none;
}
div.output_area .mglyph > img {
  max-width: none;
}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.output_area {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 1px 0 1px 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
div.output_unrecognized {
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
}
div.output_unrecognized a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.output_unrecognized a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
.rendered_html {
  color: #000;

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Self-Join-to-extract-information-in-two-columns">Self-Join to extract information in two columns<a class="anchor-link" href="#Self-Join-to-extract-information-in-two-columns">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="The-problem:"><em>The problem:</em><a class="anchor-link" href="#The-problem:">¶</a></h3><p>In timeseries data, information for an entity (here, a team) is sometimes in one column, sometimes in another. We want to compute the difference in the entity's value from one timepoint to the next. But this is not straightforward.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Our dataset is FiveThirtyEight's NFL Elo Rankings. Note, I have cropped this dataset to seasons 2007 & after.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">elo_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Data/nfl_games.csv'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Here is what our dataframe looks like:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">elo_df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[4]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>

        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    }

</style>

    </tr>
  </thead>

      <td>2007</td>
      <td>0</td>
      <td>0</td>
      <td>WSH</td>
      <td>MIA</td>
      <td>1448.841</td>
      <td>1489.941</td>
      <td>0.534341</td>
      <td>16</td>
      <td>13</td>
      <td>1.0</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>2007-09-09</td>

    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>3</th>
      <td>2007-09-09</td>

      <td>0</td>
      <td>0</td>
      <td>SEA</td>
      <td>TB</td>
      <td>1511.936</td>
      <td>1417.385</td>
      <td>0.714726</td>
      <td>20</td>
      <td>6</td>
      <td>1.0</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>4</th>
      <td>2007-09-09</td>
      <td>2007</td>
      <td>0</td>
      <td>0</td>
      <td>CLE</td>
      <td>PIT</td>
      <td>1396.563</td>
      <td>1568.569</td>
      <td>0.350697</td>
      <td>7</td>
      <td>34</td>
      <td>0.0</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The entries are by game. We want to calculate the change in a team's Elo ranking score from one week to the next. We will ultimately want to execute a 'shift' to get the before- and after-Elo scores in the same row. But first, we must address the fact that sometimes a team is 'team1' and other times it is 'team2':</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">elo_df</span><span class="p">[(</span><span class="n">elo_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'team1'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'NO'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">|</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">elo_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'team2'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'NO'</span><span class="p">)][[</span><span class="s1">'date'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'team1'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'team2'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'elo1'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'elo2'</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[5]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>date</th>
      <th>team1</th>
      <th>team2</th>
      <th>elo1</th>
      <th>elo2</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>0</th>
      <td>2007-09-06</td>
      <td>IND</td>
      <td>NO</td>
      <td>1653.923</td>
      <td>1515.973</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>28</th>
      <td>2007-09-16</td>
      <td>TB</td>
      <td>NO</td>
      <td>1402.979</td>
      <td>1500.922</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>47</th>
      <td>2007-09-24</td>
      <td>NO</td>
      <td>TEN</td>
      <td>1468.805</td>
      <td>1506.098</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>74</th>
      <td>2007-10-07</td>
      <td>NO</td>
      <td>CAR</td>
      <td>1437.203</td>
      <td>1484.207</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>85</th>
      <td>2007-10-14</td>
      <td>SEA</td>
      <td>NO</td>
      <td>1531.254</td>
      <td>1422.503</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To remedy this, we'll effectively perform two "self-joins" of the table. One on team1 and its Elo score and game score, and one on team2</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">elo_append_cols_h</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'date'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'season'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'neutral'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'playoff'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'team1'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'elo1'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'score1'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">elo_append_cols_a</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'date'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'season'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'neutral'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'playoff'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'team2'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'elo2'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'score2'</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">elo_df_h</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">elo_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">elo_append_cols_h</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">elo_df_a</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">elo_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">elo_append_cols_a</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">elo_df_h</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">elo_df_h</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'elo1'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'elo'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'team1'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'team'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'score1'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'score'</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">elo_df_a</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">elo_df_a</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'elo2'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'elo'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'team2'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'team'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'score2'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'score'</span><span class="p">})</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Here is what one half of the self-joined dataframes looks like. It contains only the data for team 1. The other dataframe, as you can guess, contains only the data for team2.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">elo_df_h</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[9]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">

      <td>BUF</td>
      <td>1516.684</td>

    <tr>

      <td>0</td>
      <td>0</td>
      <td>SEA</td>

    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>4</th>

      <td>2007</td>

      <td>CLE</td>
      <td>1396.563</td>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We append one df to the other, sort by date, and then apply a shift:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">elo_df_flat</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">elo_df_h</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">elo_df_a</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ignore_index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">elo_df_flat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'date'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">elo_df_flat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">drop</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">elo_df_flat</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'elo_after'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">elo_df_flat</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'team'</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="s1">'elo'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shift</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">elo_df_flat</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'elo_delta'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">elo_df_flat</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'elo_after'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">elo_df_flat</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'elo'</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Recall from our glimpses above that IND played NO in the first game. Their elo_delta's should sum to 0, and they do:</p>

</pre></div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now, we merge back with the original dataframe on date & team = team1, merging only 'elo_delta'.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">elo_df_flat_for_merge</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">elo_df_flat</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">'date'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'team'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'elo_delta'</span><span class="p">]]</span>

<span class="n">elo_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">merge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">elo_df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">elo_df_flat_for_merge</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">left_on</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'date'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'team1'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">right_on</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'date'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'team'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="n">elo_df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'team'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">elo_df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'elo_delta'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'elo_delta1'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {

    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;

  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {

  padding: 5px;

}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {

}

}

}
@media print {

}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {

div.input_prompt {

}

/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;

  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}

}

}

  max-width: none;
}

}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.output_area {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 1px 0 1px 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
div.output_unrecognized {

}

}

</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Metis-Project-2:-Predicting-NFL-Elo-rankings">Metis Project 2: Predicting NFL Elo rankings<a class="anchor-link" href="#Metis-Project-2:-Predicting-NFL-Elo-rankings">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>GitHub repo: <a href="https://github.com/kbfreder/nfl-predictions">https://github.com/kbfreder/nfl-predictions</a></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Project-Background">Project Background<a class="anchor-link" href="#Project-Background">¶</a></h3><p>Project 2, aka "Project Luther" required us to create a Regression model from data we scraped from the web</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Project-Design">Project Design<a class="anchor-link" href="#Project-Design">¶</a></h3><p>An Elo rating system is a measure of relative strength in a zero-sum game such as chess or soccer. It is named after Arpad Elo, who created the system to improve chess rankings in the 1960s. A difference in competitors’ Elo scores serves as a predictor of who will win and by how much.</p>
<p><a href="https://fivethirtyeight.com">FiveThirtyEight</a>, the popular website that applies statistical analyses to politics, economics, and sports, has implemented an Elo ranking system for NFL teams. They claim their ranking algorithm is based only on final score and location (home vs. away) of game.</p>
<p>I used FiveThirtyEight’s Elo rankings and game statistics to predict how a team’s Elo ranking will change after a given week’s game. Insights from this model could reveal statistics that indicate a team’s success as well as inform more favorable bets.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Tools">Tools<a class="anchor-link" href="#Tools">¶</a></h3><ul>
<li>Web Scraping: Selenium, BeautifulSoup</li>
<li>Data Handling: Python, Pandas, Numpy, SciPy, Pickling</li>
<li>Data Fitting: Statsmodel, scikit-learn</li>
<li>Visualization: Matplotlib, Seaborn</li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Data">Data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Data">¶</a></h3><p>FiveThirtyEight provides their Elo rankings as a .csv file on their ‘nfl-elo-game’ GitHub repository. (See <a href="#footnote_01">Footnote 1</a>.) I scraped <a href="www.pro-football-referene.com">Pro Football Reference</a> for game and boxscore statistics for the 267 games in each of the 2007-2017 seasons.  This initially provided me with 5858 rows and 44 features.</p>
<p>My target was the change in a team's Elo score before and after a given week’s game, referred to hereafter as $\Delta$Elo. When Team A plays Team B, $\Delta$EloA - $\Delta$EloB, so performing analysis by game was most appropriate. This halved my number of rows and nearly doubled my number of features.</p>
<p>I calculated trailing season averages (SA) of game statistics. After cleaning and exclusion, I had 2540 rows and 53 features to build a model upon. The features are listed in my <a href="https://github.com/kbfreder/nfl-predictions">GitHub repo</a>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Modeling">Modeling<a class="anchor-link" href="#Modeling">¶</a></h3><p>I performed a 75:25 training:test split. Using the training set, I examined the following Linear Regression models and pre-processing tools from scikit-learn and statsmodel:</p>
<ul>
<li>Ordinary Least Squares (OLS) / Linear Regression</li>
<li>Polynomial Features</li>
<li>Standard Scaling</li>
<li>Regularization:<ul>
<li>Lasso Regularization</li>
<li>Ridge Regularization</li>
<li>ElasticNet Regularization. </li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p>I explored their performance with a combination of different features. For model evaluation and feature selection, I used 5-fold cross-validation. I ultimately chose an Elastic Net Regularization with 2nd-order Polynomial features and Standard Scaling, with a lambda of 0.173 and an L1-ratio of 0.714. The 15 columns which provided the best R2 and MSE while offering the simplest model are listed below in <a href="#footnote_02">Footnote 2</a> and were used in the final model.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Results">Results<a class="anchor-link" href="#Results">¶</a></h3><p>The results of applying my model to the Test (hold-out) set shown below.</p>
<p><img src="Final_Model_on_Test.svg" alt="Predicted-vs-Actual scatter plot"></p>
<table>
<thead><tr>
<th>Metric</th>
<th>Train</th>
<th>Test </th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>R2</strong></td>
<td>0.389</td>
<td>0.383</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>MSE</strong></td>
<td>340</td>
<td>331</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>RMSE</strong></td>
<td>18.4</td>
<td>18.1</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>While the R2 is not as high as I would have hoped, the R2 and MSE are similar between the Training and Test sets. This suggests that my model is not over-fitting and will perform similarly on data unseen. Inspection of the residuals reveals them to be normally distributed, although the tails fit less well to a normal distribution.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Lessons-Learned">Lessons Learned<a class="anchor-link" href="#Lessons-Learned">¶</a></h3><p>In evaluating my model against the Elo ratings of FiveThirtyEight, I realized that choosing to predict Elo ratings was a complicated and fraught target. The FiveThrityEight algorithm computes the number of Elo ratings point that are exchanged between teams after a game (i.e. $\Delta$Elo) from the difference in Elo ratings between teams, adjusted for home-field advantage, and the margin of victory. I was trying to predict something ($\Delta$Elo) which was calculated using post-game knowledge (point difference) and which was dependent on this algorithm (pre-game Elo ratings). A better, more direct, target might have been point difference, using Elo ratings as variables. Anyway, when I tested my model vs. FiveThirtyEight’s algorithm, I did rather poorly. Using a Brier system for scoring probibalistic models, my forecasts would have gotten 424 points per season; FiveThrityEight averages 892 points. (See the Predictions folder in my <a href="https://github.com/kbfreder/nfl-predictions">GitHub</a>.)</p>
<p>I initially made an error in how I calculated $\Delta$Elo. See the accompanying blog post, <a href="2018-10-08_PandaTricks.html">Panda Tricks: self-joins</a>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="Footnotes">Footnotes<a class="anchor-link" href="#Footnotes">¶</a></h4><p><a name="footnote_01"></a>1. I initally found the .js source url behind their interactive historical Elo graphics. I extracted data for one team (Green Bay, obviously), but given that FiveThirtyEight offered a neat and tidy .csv, I opted to use that rather than extract more data from the javascript file.</p>
<p><a name="footnote_02"></a>2. Columns in final model:</p>
<ul>
<li>Team 1 Elo (before game)</li>
<li>Team 2 Elo (before game)</li>
<li>First Downs</li>
<li>Fourth-Down Attempts</li>
<li>number of Penalties</li>
<li>Penalty Yards</li>
<li>Points against</li>
<li>Points scored</li>
<li>Rush Attempts</li>
<li>Time of Possession</li>
<li>Win Percentage</li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>
</div>
